RecordThing.Description: Bien que d'innombrables "meilleures" façons de cuisiner {LINK:FoodPage;Food} aient été inventées au cours des dernières centaines d'années, peu sont aussi durables ou faciles à fabriquer que le micro-ondes OK-Zoomer. Sous licence de {LINK:Xigo;Xigo}, les plans sont basés sur un modèle classique du milieu du 21e siècle, lui donnant une charmante sensation rétro. Mais ne vous inquiétez pas, il fait osciller les molécules {GAS:Water} plus qu'adéquatement. Fixez-le simplement à un {THING:StructureBench} à l'aide d'un {THING:ItemWrench} pour l'alimenter, suivez la recette et vous cuisinez.

Se situant quelque part entre un presse-agrumes puissant et un alambic d'alchimiste, le processeur de réactifs {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} transforme certaines matières premières et aliments en ingrédients de cuisine et d'artisanat. Indispensable dans n'importe quelle cuisine d'espace, il suffit de le boulonner au banc et vous êtes prêt à partir.
En ce qui concerne les bras gauches, c'est un exemple acceptable, quoique légèrement oubliable, du genre. Il a connu des jours meilleurs.
One of a pair. The other is probably nearby.
If the eyes are windows to the soul, what does that make the head?
A leg, is a leg, is a leg.
This is a woman's right leg. To judge by its state, she was fairly healthy, of average height, with a tendency to walk on the balls of her feet.
This isn't going anywhere by itself.
Your arm is your fourth most important body part.
There's nothing funny about this humerus.
{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}s need to keep their heads at all times.
This is a leg. Someone probably misses it.
Legs are really useful things, but wheels would have been cool.
Once, this was most of someone.
The fluffy heart of a harmless proto-hen.
Let's not over-complicate things. It's a chicken.
A chicken head is useful for many things, but principally voodoo and space curses.
A chicken leg.
Also a chicken leg.
A chicken's tail is arguably its least endearing feature.
A chicken wing.
A chicken wing.
Part of a chicken.
A chicken's head. Once used as currency by long-departed alien races.
A chicken leg.
A chicken leg.
A chicken tail.
It's a chicken wing.
A chicken wing.
The head of a chicken. Once, it had the heart of a tiger.
A chicken leg.
A chicken leg.
A chicken's tail.
A chicken wing.
A chicken wing.
An alien's arm.
An alien's arm.
An alien's body, or a very convincing fake.
An alien's head.
An alien's leg.
An alien's other leg.
An alien's pelvis.
A rooster's body.
A rooster's head. The perfect gift for mother's day.
A rooster's leg.
A rooster's leg.
A rooster's tail.
A rooster's wing.
A rooster's wing.
A rooster's body.
The head of a brown rooster.
A brown rooster's leg.
A rooster's leg.
A rooster's tail.
A rooster's wing.
A brown rooster's wing. Well, brownish.

The Lorenz atmos analyzer is a multi-functional mass-spectrometer designed by {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} for use with the OreCore {THING:ItemTablet}. It displays the pressure, concentration and molar quantity of {LINK:GasPage;gas} in rooms, tanks, or pipe networks.

When added to the OreCore {THING:ItemTablet}, {LINK:Asura;Asura's}'s ReadyMed medical analyzer reveals the health, or otherwise, of users various organs. Due to a design flaw, older models were notorious for producing quasar-like levels of x-ray radiation. Recent advances in shielding have more than halved the risk to users.

A minor masterpiece of micro-electronic engineering, the network analyzer displays the current, voltage and wattage of a cable network, as well as any devices connected to it. Based on a widely-copied {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} design, it's used in conjunction with the OreCore {THING:ItemTablet}.
This is you.

When added to a {THING:StructureConsole}, air control circuit boards allow you to program an {THING:StructureActiveVent}. As with small dogs and 83% of people, air control circuits have only three modes : Pressure, Draft and Offline. Pressure mode maintains a 100kPa atmosphere, switching the active vent between inward and outward flow until target pressure is achieved. Draft mode allows you to pair active vents to circulate air. Offline mode deactivates the vent.

Rumored to have been first sketched on a {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} toilet wall by a disgruntled engineer, the Exgress airlock control circuit board’s versatility and ease of fabrication has made it the {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} control system of choice for {THING:StructureAirlock} cycling protocols.
To enter setup mode, insert the board into a {THING:StructureConsole} along with a data disk. In this mode, you can see all data-accessible objects currently connected to the {THING:StructureConsole}. Doors, lights, gas sensors and slave consoles can be selected (highlighted green), and will be controlled once the data disk is removed.

Surveillance is sometimes necessary when building bases in highly hostile environments. The camera display circuit board allows wary Stationeers to turn a {THING:StructureConsole} into a security display when connected to a {THING:StructureCamera}.

A basic tool of {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} base construction, this circuit board provides a way to open and close a {THING:StructureCompositeDoor}, {THING:StructureBlastDoor} or {THING:StructureGlassDoor} remotely, when connected to a {THING:StructureConsole}. This system can be further linked to {THING:StructureMotionSensor} to create automatic doors.

Information is power. Place this circuitboard into a {THING:StructureConsole} to create a display that shows gas pressure or temperature of any connected tank, storage cannister, {THING:ItemPipeAnalyizer} or {THING:ItemGasSensor}.
Can't decide which mode you love most? This circuit board allows you to switch any connected device between operation modes.

Under distant suns and demanding environments, {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} systems need to balance reliability, resilience and versatility. The power control board allows remote enabling and disabling of selected devices, disconnecting manual operation.
The circuit board has two modes : 'Link' switches all devices on or off; 'Toggle' switches each device to their alternate state.

When the original {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} Handbook collapsed under its own weight into a singularity, certain information was irretrievably lost. Amongst this mysterious corpus of knowledge is the exact purpose of the ship display board.
Adding a solar control board to a {THING:StructureConsole} lets you manually control the horizontal and vertical angles of any connected {THING:StructureSolarPanel}.

The {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}-designed Huxi portable air conditioner cools by drawing heat from the atmosphere and storing it, or adding heat to the atmosphere from its internal tank. With a max internal pressure of 8106kPa, its capacity is relatively limited, physics being clear on this subject. To extend its temperature storage ability, bolt the Huxi to a {THING:StructureTankConnector}, then connect it to a pipe network supplying hot or cold {LINK:GasPage;gases}.

The humble dynamic crate has become a symbol of {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} invention and independence. With twelve slots and handles at either end for ease of carriage, it's both standard issue and critical kit for cadets and Commanders alike.

Portable gas tanks do one thing: store gas. But there's lots you can do with them. To refill the tank, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or bad things happen. Once it's full, you can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterOxygen} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could vent the tank's variable flow rate valve into a room and create an atmosphere. They also attach to rovers and rockets. Alternatively, kick it over and practice barrel rolling. The possibilities are endless.

Portable gas tanks do one thing: store gas. To refill the tank, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or ... boom. Once it's full, you can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterCarbonDioxide} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could vent the tank's variable flow rate valve into a room and create an atmosphere ... of sorts.

Portable gas tanks store gas. To refill one, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or bad things happen. Once it's full, you can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could vent the tank's variable flow rate valve into a room and create an atmosphere.

Portable tanks store gas. They're good at it. If you need to refill a tank, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or things get messy. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterFuel} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could use a {THING:ItemWrench} to attach it to a rover or rocket for later. It's really up to you.

Portable tanks store gas. If you need to refill a tank, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or you'll end up with {GAS:Nitrogen} in places you weren't expecting. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterNitrogen} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could use a {THING:ItemWrench} to attach it to a rover or rocket for later.

Portable tanks store gas. If you need to refill a tank, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or you'll be picking tank shards out of your face. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterOxygen} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could vent it into a sealed room to create an atmosphere. Or even paint it pink, call it Steve and fill that sad space in your heart.

Portable tanks store gas. To refill one, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to a pipe network. Don't fill it above 10 MPa, unless you're the sort who loves complicated, flammable emergencies. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterVolatiles} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could use a {THING:ItemWrench} to attach to a rocket and show it around the Solar System.

This portable tank stores liquid, and liquid only. You just have to fill it up. To do this, bolt one to a {THING:ItemTankConnector} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to {THING:StructurePipeLiquidStraight} to supply liquid to a network. Try to keep pressure under 10 MPa, or you'll end up wet, hurt and sorry, without any of the fun. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterWater} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could use a {THING:ItemWrench} to attach it to a rocket and take it somewhere distant and dry, then feel good about yourself.

Every {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's} best friend, the portable generator gets you up and running, fast. Fill it with a {THING:ItemGasCanisterFuel} to power up and charge a {THING:ItemBatteryCell}, or attach it to a {THING:StructurePowerConnector} to link it into your electrical network. It's pressure driven, so functions more efficiently at lower temperatures, and REALLY efficiently if supercooled. Perfecting your fuel mix also makes a big difference.

Philippe Starck might not applaud, but this battery-powered light source undarkens the corners when illumination's lacking. Powered by any battery, it's a 'no-frills' {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} design that can be cheaply fabricated with the minimum of fuss. Unless you like fuss. In which case, fuss all you like.

A portable scrubber does just what it sounds like : removes specific substances from the air. For instance, attaching a {THING:ItemGasFilterCarbonDioxide} will pull {GAS:CarbonDioxide} from the surrounding atmosphere. Note that the scrubber has room for one battery and two filters, which will double its operating speed. Neat. When it reaches an internal pressure of 8106kPA, an error signal will flash on the switch, indicating it needs to be emptied. Either vent it directly, or attach it to a pipe network via a {THING:ItemTankConnector} and a {THING:ItemWrench}.
The answer to the age-old question, 'Is there life on other planets?', is 'I guess so.'
Once a chick is hatched, it gets hungry. It will eat soybeans, corn, and wheat, and lay eggs. Some will be fertilized, producing further chickens. Some will not.
Like so many of its brethren, this is a chicken. A brown one. It will eat soybeans, corn, and wheat, and lay eggs. Some will be fertilized, producing further chickens. Some will not.
It's a chicken, as white as moondust. It will eat soybeans, corn, and wheat, and lay eggs. Some will be fertilized, producing further chickens. Some will not.
While humanity has historically referred to these creatures as 'Greys', they prefer the more inclusive 'Trans-beige' label.
This is a rooster. It is black. There is dignity in this.
The common brown rooster. Don't let it hear you say that.

Portable gas tanks store gas, and gas only. To refill one, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 100 atmospheres, or you'll taste the delicate flavor of regret. Use tanks to fill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could vent it into a sealed room to create an atmosphere, attach it to a rover and take it for a drive, or just use it for loud, expensive target practice.
When constructed, this kit places an {THING:StructureActiveVent} on any support structure.
This kit places a {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl} (APC) on any support structure. The APC kit has two options, selecting which direction you would like the APC power to flow.
This kit produces a 5-slot {THING:ItemBatteryCharger}.

Unlike 8-tracks, laser-disks and email, books never totally vanished. Technology may have evolved, but something about the texture and sexiness of the physical book has seen them endure in a unique, if slightly irrational informational niche.

Bodily metaphors are tired and anthropocentric, but it was Frida Stuppen, the first {LINK:ODA;ODA} Administrator, who said, 'Let the cabling be as the nerve and the vessel, transmitting power and data alike through systems we forge among the stars.' Later commentators suggested that she was simply putting a romantic gloss on a piece of dubious economy. Whatever the case, standard cabling is where any {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's} network begins. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.
A safe and slightly rave-some source of blue light. Snap to activate.
Enliven the dreariest, airless rock with this glowy green light. Snap to activate.
A red glowstick. Snap to activate. Then reach for the lasers.
Snap the glowstick to activate a pale radiance that keeps the darkness at bay.
Dispel the darkness with this yellow glowstick.

Humanity wouldn't have got to space without humble, combustible coal. Burn it in a {THING:StructureSolidFuelGenerator}, smelt it in the {THING:StructureFurnace} to create {LINK:AlloysPage;alloys}, or use it in the {THING:ApplianceReagentProcessor} to make {THING:ItemSprayCanBlack}.
Copper ingots are created by smelting {THING:ItemCopperOre} in the {THING:StructureFurnace} and {THING:StructureArcFurnace}, and used to create a variety of items.

Copper is a chemical element with the symbol "Cu". This common and highly conductive material is found on most astronomical bodies and is used in a variety of manufacturing processes including electronic components, alloys, and wires.
A long growth time staple crop. Its low requirement for darkness allows for accelerated growing if provided with extra light.

{LINK:Recurso;Recurso's} entry-level crowbar is useful in a variety of everyday {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} settings, from opening {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl}s and unpowered {THING:StructureAirlock}s, to splatting pan-dimensional headcrabs, should the need arise.

The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} Off-whirled Hand Drill has been a companion to {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} for decades. Essential for assembling and deconstructing various items and structures, regardless of gravity, pressure or temperature.

In the distant past, one of Earth's great champions taught a generation of 'Fix-It People' that duct tape was the answer to any problem. {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have demonstrated that this is truth holds strong, so long as the problem is a damaged {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, or even a {THING:StructureSolarPanel}. To use on yourself : put duct tape in your active hand, hold RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON to automatically repair damage.

Resolving, finally, the question of which came first : it was the egg. Eggs are deposited every 60-90 seconds by your average chicken. If an egg has been fertilized, and is kept between 20C-30C, an {THING:EntityChick} will emerge. For the rest, there is the {THING:ApplianceMicrowave} and all manner of {LINK:FoodPage;gustatory} consolations.
Within, eggs reside in mysterious, marmoreal silence.
The EVA suit is the basic suit {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} need to survive in the inhospitable environment of space. For more information on EVA suits, consult the {LINK:EVAPage;EVA suit} guide.
Pulverized {THING:ItemWheat}, a key ingredient in many foods created by the {THING:ApplianceMicrowave} and the {THING:ItemKitAutomatedOven}.

When fabricated, the {GAS:CarbonDioxide} {SLOT:GasCanister} is filled a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres) and colored default grey. Used as a secondary fuel in the {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}, it can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to over pressurize when refilling, or it may go 'bang'.

While this byproduct from smelting - sometimes known simply as 'X' - is a toxin, its specific heat makes it a valuable coolant. All gas canisters are full when fabricated to a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), and can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to pressurize beyond 10MPa, or it may go 'bang'.

The portable {SLOT:GasCanister} is the {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's} basic unit of {LINK:GasPage;gas} delivery. Rated to a standard pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), empty gas canisters can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to pressurize beyond 10MPa, or it may go 'bang'. Contains 64L of gas.

The orange portable {LINK:GasPage;fuel} {SLOT:GasCanister} supplies a 64L mixture of 66% {GAS:Volatiles}/34% {GAS:Oxygen} for powering such items as the {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} and the {THING:DynamicGenerator}. All gas canisters are full when fabricated to a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), and can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to pressurize beyond 10MPa, or it may go 'bang'.

The green portable {GAS:Nitrogen} {SLOT:GasCanister} supplies propellant for the {THING:ItemSpacepack} and the {THING:ItemHardJetpack}. All gas canisters are full when fabricated to a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), and can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to pressurize beyond 10MPa, or it may go 'bang'.

The white portable 64L {SLOT:GasCanister} is the {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's} basic unit of {GAS:Oxygen} delivery. All gas canisters are full when fabricated to a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), and can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to pressurize beyond 10MPa, or it may go 'bang'.

The blue portable {GAS:Water} {SLOT:GasCanister} has a 64L capacity, supplying {GAS:Water} to items like the {THING:DynamicHydroponics} unit, or any other connected system. All liquid canisters are full when fabricated to a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), and can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicLiquidCanisterEmpty} or {THING:StructureLiquidTankStorage} for refill.

Given humanity's obsession with exhaling {GAS:CarbonDioxide}, all {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} are issued two basic {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} {GAS:CarbonDioxide} {SLOT:GasFilter} as part of their standard deployment kit (SDK). These filters allow passage of {GAS:CarbonDioxide} into the suit's waste {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty}, but are also critical components of the {THING:DynamicScrubber} and the {THING:StructureFiltration}. The {THING:ItemGasFilterCarbonDioxideM} and {THING:ItemGasFilterCarbonDioxideL} are also available.

Filters are used to capture various gases, such as waste emissions from a {THING:StructureFurnace} or {THING:StructureArcFurnace}. Adding {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}-designed {GAS:Pollutant} filters to a {THING:ItemDynamicScrubber} allows you to isolate this gas, then add it to a pipe network and employ its excellent coolant properties in a {THING:StructureWallCooler}. Try not to inhale.

Filters are used to capture various gases, which can be disposed of or used elsewhere. {GAS:Nitrogen} is a byproduct of smelting various ores, notably {THING:ItemNitrice}, which may be combined with {GAS:Oxygen} to make a breathable - and considerably less flammable - atmosphere.

{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} have cornered the market in filter design. Their trademarked templates are simple to print and highly efficient at capturing various gases, which can be disposed of or used elsewhere. {GAS:Oxygen} is a common byproduct of smelting various ores, but must be filtered of such impurities as {GAS:Nitrogen} using this filter and various devices, such as the {THING:ItemDynamicScrubber}.

Filters are used to capture various gases, which can be disposed of or used elsewhere. {GAS:Volatiles} are created by exposing {THING:ItemVolatiles} to heat. The product can then be collected and combined with {GAS:Oxygen} to create fuel, or used within a {THING:StructureFurnace} to smelt ores and create {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.
{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} filters are used to capture various gases, which can be disposed of, or used elsewhere. {GAS:Water} can be collected by filtering smelted {THING:ItemIce}
This kit produces a {THING:ItemGasTankStorage} for refilling a {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty}.
This kit produces a {THING:ItemLiquidTankStorage} for refilling a {THING:ItemLiquidCanisterEmpty}.

A fundamental construction component, glass sheets are created from {REAGENT:Silicon}. Fabricated on the {THING:StructureAutolathe}, they are used to make {THING:StructureSolarPanel;Solar Panels}, {THING:StructureAirlock;Airlocks} and many other structures.

There is an enduring paradox at the heart of the {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} project : An initiative conceived as 'cut-price space exploration' uses {REAGENT:Gold} as a fundamental ingredient in fabricating so much of its equipment and materiel.

Surprisingly common throughout the Solar System, {REAGENT:Gold} is thought to originate in the heart of supernovas, gathering as dust in the early stages of solar formation, then incorporating into the slowly accreting planetary bodies. Now a prized element in {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} construction, {REAGENT:Gold} is valued not for its beauty, but its reliability : inert, durable, conductive and highly stable, gold's strength is that it does nothing.

Invented by the Romans, who threw Greek Fire at their enemies in ceramic jars, the word 'grenade' is derived from the Old French word for 'pomegranate', as many modern grenades resemble this round, many-seeded fruit. Also like many grenades before it, this one goes boom and breaks stuff.
As the name suggests, this is a hat.

Three centuries of pharmaceutical technology compressed into one small, easy to ingest pill : the Heal Pill, aka the Proton Pill, aka Mr Happy contains active enzymes, therapeutic proteins, modified microbial strains, and mammalian cell line analogues in a single-dose boost of high purity, efficacy, and potency that potentiates a swift parasympathetic immune response.
This kits creates a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} for growing various plants.

Water ice can be found on most planets in the Solar System, though not all worlds visited by {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} possess this resource. Highly sensitive to temperature, ice will begin to melt as soon as it is mined, unless kept in the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}. When melting, ice produces a mixture of {GAS:Steam} and {GAS:Nitrogen} gas.
This kit creates an {THING:ItemIgniter} unit.
Mysterious in the extreme, the function of this item is lost to the ages.

The most basic unit of construction available to {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}-kind, iron ingots are created by smelting {THING:ItemIronOre} in the {THING:StructureFurnace} and {THING:StructureArcFurnace}, and used to create a variety of items.

Abundant throughout the Solar System, iron is the {LINK:OrePage;ore} most commonly used by {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} constructing offworld bases. It can be smelted into both {THING:ItemIronIngot}s and {THING:ItemSteelIngot}s.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureAirlock} portal.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureAirConditioner}, {THING:StructureElectrolyzer}, {THING:StructureFiltration}, {THING:StructureNitrolyzer} or {THING:H2Combustor}.
This kit produces a single station {THING:StructureBattery}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureCentrifuge}.
This kit produces a variety of unpowered chutes.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureComputer}.
This kit produces a range of {THING:StructureConsole}s and displays such as the {THING:StructureConsoleLED1x2}.
This kit produces conveyor elements, such as the {THING:StructureConveyorStraight}.
This kit produces a range of cryo tubes which can be used to heal players and player organs as well as revive dead players
This kit produces an engine.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureFabricator}. (Creative Mode only)
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureFurnace}.
This kit produces a range of {LINK:FurniturePage;furniture}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructurePressureRegulator}.

This kit produces a range of sensors, including {THING:StructureGasSensor}, {THING:StructureDaylightSensor}, {THING:StructureMotionSensor}, {THING:StructureProximitySensor} and {THING:StructureOccupancySensor}.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureSign1x1} or {THING:StructureSign2x1}.
This kit produces a range of sleepers which will keep players hydrated and fed while logged out - as long as a breathable atmosphere is provided.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureSolarPanel} and several variants.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureStairs4x2} and several variants.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureStellarAnchor}.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureSuitStorage}.
This kit produces either a {THING:StructureTankBig} or {THING:StructureTankSmall}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureTorpedoTube}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureGunTurret}.
This kit produces a range of composite wall elements and windows.
A labeller lets you set names and values on a variety of devices and structures, including {THING:StructureConsole} and {LINK:LogicPage;Logic}.
A charming, if useless, pseudo-weapon. (Creative only.)

Full disclosure, it's not actually 'milk', but an {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero-invented} synthesis of 5ml {THING:ItemSoyOil} and 5g {THING:ItemFern}, delicately blended in the {THING:ApplianceChemistryStation}. Surprisingly filling, it can be used as an ingredient to cook other {LINK:FoodPage;food} in the {THING:ApplianceMicrowave} or {THING:StructureAutomatedOven}. Think, {THING:ItemMuffin}.

Originally developed by {LINK:Recurso;Recurso Espaciais} for asteroid mining, the {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's} mining belt has room for two {LINK:ToolPage;tools} and eight {LINK:OrePage;ore} stacks. While wearing the belt, {LINK:OrePage;ore} is automatically stored there when mined. Volatile and temperature-dependent remain stable in the environmentally controlled unit.

The handheld 'Topo' tri-cone rotary mining drill was made for one thing: quick digging. Modeled on a classic {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} zero-g design, it functions equally well in vacuum and atmosphere, with cemented carbide bits to increase resilience and bearing life, and reduce spalling. As Jenk Murtons once said, 'The Topo don't stopo.'
This kit creates a {THING:ItemPassiveVent} among other variants.

When the sun sets and the {THING:ItemMiningDrill} runs dead, its batteries drained and your {THING:StructureSolarPanel} cold and lifeless, the {THING:StructureAutolathe} empty, the way forward unclear, one thing holds back the endless night of defeat : the trusty pickaxe.

Three centuries of pharmaceutical technology compressed into one small, easy to ingest pill : the Heal Pill, aka the Proton Pill, aka Mr Happy contains active enzymes, therapeutic proteins, modified microbial strains, and mammalian cell line analogues in a single-dose boost of high purity, efficacy, and potency that potentiates a swift parasympathetic immune response.

Through rarely publicized, the existence of this pill is an open secret. For use when all else has failed, the Sayonara Suppository immobilizes and rapidly ends the average {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}. The delivery mode ensures that if a Stationeer chooses to take this pill, they really have to want it.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeAnalysizer}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeCorner}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeCrossJunction}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeCrossJunction3}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeCrossJunction5}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeCrossJunction6}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureDigitalValve}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureGasMixer}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeLabel}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeMeter}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeRadiator}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeStraight}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeTJunction}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureValve}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureVolumePump}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureLiquidValve}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePowerConnector}.

Reagent mix is pure potential. A slurry of undifferentiated {LINK:OrePage;ores}, it is output by the {THING:StructureRecycler} and can be fed into the {THING:StructureCentrifuge} to separate and recover the individual materials. Reagent mix is also output by the {THING:StructureFurnace} when the current contents are ejected without smelting a specific ingot.
Designed to burn anywhere in the Solar System, the EZC magnesium fusee supplies its own oxygen to fuel combustion, and dispel the eternal night of space.
A mysterious piece of technology, rumored to have Zrillian origins.

This standard issue frictional adherence adjustor is a top of the line, bi-rotational model with a columnated uni-grip. It's definitely not just a screwdriver. Use it for construction and deconstruction of certain kits, and setting values on {LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic} units.
Security cameras can be paired with a {THING:StructureMotionSensor}, then connected to a {THING:StructureConsole} fitted with a {THING:CircuitboardCameraDisplay} for that 'always watched' feeling.
There was a time when humanity really wanted to keep space clean. That time has passed.

The basic space helmet insulates {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} against everything from hard vacuum to weird cooking smells. Providing a pressure-controlled, breathable atmosphere, it comes with a built-in light powered by your {THING:ItemEvaSuit} {THING:ItemBatteryCell}. It also incorporates a lock/unlock feature to avoid accidental opening, as well as a flush function to expel and replace the internal atmosphere. If damaged, use {THING:ItemDuctTape} to fix it, or paint it any color you like using the {THING:AppliancePaintMixer}.

The basic {LINK:CHAC;CHAC} spacepack isn't 'technically' a jetpack, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the {LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister} is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Indispensable for building, mining and general movement, it has ten storage slots and lets {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} fly at 3m/s, compared to the more powerful {THING:ItemJetpackBasic} or {THING:ItemHardJetpack}. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stablizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. USE: 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.
Optez pour le classique, le clandestin ou l'authentiquement gothique avec de la peinture noire, qui peut être appliquée sur la plupart des objets. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.
Quelle sorte de couleur est le bleu ? C'est le genre de couleur qui dit : "Hé, et moi alors ?". Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.
Dans les cercles artistiques plus créatifs de {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}, l'absence de marron est souvent regrettée, mais rarement modifiée. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.

Le vert est la couleur de la vie et du désir. Paradoxalement, c'est aussi la couleur de l'envie et de la tolérance. Elle évoque la maladie, la jeunesse et la richesse. Mais en réalité, c'est simplement ce que la lumière fait à environ 500 milliardièmes de mètre. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.
Peut-être la couleur la plus populaire dans l'univers, le gris a été inventé pour que les designers aient quelque chose à faire. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.
Plutôt qu'une seule couleur, le kaki est une catégorie d'ennui, l'équivalent pigmentaire d'un épisode dépressif léger. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.
L'orange est amusant, mais évoque également des dangers. Trônant fièrement au milieu du spectre visuel, il n'a rien à prouver. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.

Avec l'invention des colorants chimiques durables, le 20e siècle a conféré à cette teinte pâle de rouge des connotations d'innocence et de tendresse. Pourtant, classiquement, c'était la couleur de la séduction et de l'érotisme. Les choses changent. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.
Le violet est une couleur curieuse. Il faut faire attention avec le violet. Il peut être très réussi, ou tourner terriblement, terriblement mal. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.

Le roi des couleurs, le rouge est peut-être la tonalité déterminante de l'univers. Associé au sang, à la royauté, au feu et à la damnation, c'est l'expression chromatique du pouvoir. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.
Le blanc a l'air propre, net et agréable. Mais {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeering} peut être un travail salissant. Le blanc a tendance à s'érafler. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.

Une caricature de la lumière elle-même, le jaune manque de la confiance en soi du rouge ou de l'aplomb du violet. Il est moins amusant que l'orange, mais moins émotionnellement fade que le kaki. Il est difficile de savoir quand le jaune est approprié, mais il persiste en tant que couleur primaire malgré tout. Suggérant que le jaune va rester jaune, peu importe ce que les gens pensent. Chaque Aérosol contient 20 utilisations.

Une version avancée et plus résistante des {THING:ItemIronFrames}, les cadres en acier sont placés en faisant un clic droit. Pour achever la construction, utilisez {THING:ItemSteelSheets} et un {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} dans votre main active.

Les lingots d'acier sont un alliage métallique, fabriqué dans un {THING:StructureFurnace} en fondant {THING:ItemIronOre} et {THING:ItemCoalOre} dans un rapport de 3:1. Ce n'est peut-être pas élégant, mais {THING:ItemOxite} et {THING:ItemVolatiles} peuvent être combinés dans un four dans un rapport de 1:2 pour créer le mélange gazeux nécessaire pour la fusion.
An advanced building material, {THING:ItemSteelIngot} sheets are used when constructing a {THING:StructureFrame} and several other {LINK:StructuresPage;wall} types.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureSuitStorage}.

The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} handheld 'Padi' tablet is an all-purpose data platform, provided as standard issue to all {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}. A dynamic multi-tool that accepts a range of {LINK:CartridgePage;cartridges}, the Padi becomes an {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser} or {THING:CartridgeTracker}, {THING:CartridgeMedicalAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeOreScanner}, {THING:CartridgeElectronicReader}, and various other functions.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureTankConnector}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureTankConnectorLiquid}.

If there's one piece of equipment that embodies {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} life above all else, it's the humble toolbelt (Editor's note : a recent {LINK:ODA;ODA} survey of iconic Stationeer equipment also rated the smoking, toxic ruins of an over-pressurized {THING:StructureFurnace} lying amid the charred remains of your latest base very highly). Designed to meet the most strict-ish ODA safety standards, the toolbelt's eight slots hold one thing: tools, and {THING:ItemCableCoil}. Not to be confused with the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}.

In 1934, Enrico Fermi noticed that bombarding uranium with neutrons produced a burst of beta rays, and a new material. This process was named 'nuclear fission', and resulted in cheap energy, the Cold War, and countless thousand deaths. While reasonably common throughout the Solar System, {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} are wary of the material.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureWallCooler}.
This kit creates a {THING:ItemWallHeater}.
This kit creates any one of ten {THING:ItemWallLight} variants.

Stored in the standard issue {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} {THING:ItemToolBelt}, the Arlite welding torch is used to construct a range of essential structures. An upgraded version of the classic 'Zairo' model first manufactured by {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} for modular space habitat assembly, the Arlite is powered by a single {THING:ItemGasCanisterFuel} and designed to function equally well in deep space and deep gravity wells.
A classical symbol of growth and new life, wheat takes a moderate time to grow. Its main use is to create {LINK:ReagentPage;flour} using the {THING:ApplianceReagentProcessor}.

Wirecutters allow you to deconstruct various {LINK:StructurePage;structures}, as well as cross-lay cables when held in your non-active hand, and defuse explosives as needed. Wirecutters are stored in the {THING:ItemToolBelt}, along with other essential {LINK:ToolPage;tools}.

One of humanity's enduring contributions to the cosmos, the wrench represents the essence of our species. A simple, effective and spiritually barren tool, use it to build and deconstruct a variety of {LINK:StructurePage;structures}

Motherboards are connected to {THING:StructureComputer}s to perform various technical functions. The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed} K-cops logic motherboard allows {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} to set variables and actions on specific {LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic}-controlled items.
Deprecated.

Motherboards are connected to {THING:StructureComputer}s to perform various technical functions. The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed} K-cops 10-10 sorter motherboard permits {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} to control which items a {THING:StructureSorter} does, and does not, permit to pass.

A relic of from an earlier era of space ambition, {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai's} mothership cores formed the central element of a generation's space-going creations. While Sinotai's pivot to smaller, modular craft upset some purists, motherships continue to be built and maintained by dedicated enthusiasts.
Voici votre cerveau {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}..
Les poumons sont des organes délicats. Il est conseillé de les maintenir à la bonne température et pression.
Un engin de transport {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} désuet, depuis longtemps mis hors service.

La ventilation active est un dispositif alimenté conçu pour maintenir la pression des {LINK:GasPage;gas} en pompant du gaz dans (ou hors de) un réseau de tuyaux. La ventilation active dispose de deux modes : le mode "Sortant" permet de pomper du gaz dans un espace jusqu'à atteindre la pression souhaitée ; le mode "Entrant" permet de pomper du gaz hors de l'espace jusqu'à atteindre la pression souhaitée. Le paramètre de pression peut être configuré sur une {THING:StructureConsole} connectée. La pression par défaut est de 101 kPa en mode Sortant ; 0 kPa en mode Entrant...

Construit à l'aide du {THING:ItemKitAtmospherics}, le climatiseur conçu par {LINK:ExMin;ExMin-designed} est utilisé pour augmenter ou abaisser la température des gaz d'entrée.
L'unité possède trois connexions de tuyaux : entrée, sortie et déchets. Le gaz introduit dans l'entrée sera chauffé ou refroidi pour atteindre la température cible, tandis que l'effet inverse se produira sur le gaz du réseau de déchets.
Plusieurs multiplicateurs d'efficacité peuvent influencer la quantité d'énergie utilisée par le climatiseur, et ces valeurs peuvent être consultées sur le panneau d'information vert de l'unité. À mesure que la différence de température entre l'entrée et les déchets augmente, le multiplicateur d'efficacité en fonction de la différence de température diminuera. Si la température d'entrée ou de déchets est extrêmement élevée ou basse, l'efficacité en fonction de la température opérationnelle diminuera. Si le tuyau d'entrée ou de déchets est soumis à des pressions très basses, l'efficacité en fonction de la pression diminuera.
Les {THING:StructurePipeRadiator}s peuvent être utiles pour ramener les températures extrêmes des tuyaux vers les températures normales du monde.
Pour plus d'informations sur l'utilisation du climatiseur, consultez la page des guides de {LINK:TemperatureControlPage;contrôle de la température}.

La porte étanche est un portail motorisé qui constitue le principal composant d'un sas. Tant que la porte étanche n'est pas verrouillée, elle peut être ouverte manuellement à l'aide d'un pied-de-biche.

Un Contrôle d'Alimentation de Zone (APC) remplit trois fonctions principales : Sa principale fonction est de réguler le flux d'alimentation, assurant des performances ininterrompues pour les appareils et les machines, en particulier ceux ayant une consommation fluctuante. Les APC créent également des sous-réseaux, car aucun appareil situé du côté opposé d'un APC n'est visible sur le réseau principal. Enfin, un APC recharge les batteries, qui peuvent fournir une alimentation de secours au sous-réseau en cas de panne. Notez qu'un APC nécessite une batterie pour stabiliser la consommation d'énergie. Il existe également deux variantes d'APC, chacune permettant le flux d'alimentation dans une seule direction.

An Area Power Control (APC) has three main functions. Its primary purpose is to regulate power flow, ensuring uninterrupted performance from devices and machinery, especially those with a fluctuating draw. APCs also create sub-networks, as no devices on the far side of an APC are visible on the main network. Lastly, an APC charges batteries, which can provide backup power to the sub-network in the case of an outage. Note that an APC requires a battery to stabilize power draw. It also has two variants, each allowing power to flow in one direction only.
Unlike the {THING:StructurePressureRegulator}, which closes when the input exceeds a given pressure, the back pressure regulator opens when input pressure reaches a given value.

The 5-slot {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} battery charger fits the {THING:ItemBatteryCell}, {THING:ItemBatteryCellLarge} and {THING:ItemBatteryCellNuclear}, providing up to 500W to any connected cell. Note : the older design means this device has minor power draw (10W) even when not charging.
When it's time to sit, nothing supports you like a bench. This bench is powered, so you can use appliances like the {THING:ApplianceMicrowave}.

Airtight and almost undamageable, the original 'Millmar' series of blast door was designed by off-world mining giant {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} to protect asteroid-mining facilities from nuclear-incident-level explosive decompression. Short of a pocket-sized singularity blinking into the local space-time frame, there is effectively no limit to the pressure these blast doors can contain - ideal for constructing airlocks in pressure-sensitive environments.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} life - so essential, the {LINK:ODA;ODA} designated it an official {LINK:ToolPage;'tool'} during the 3rd Decannual Stationeer Solar Conference. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} life - so essential, the {LINK:ODA;ODA} designated it an official {LINK:ToolPage;'tool'} during the 3rd Decannual Stationeer Solar Conference. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} life - so much so, the {LINK:ODA;ODA} designated it an official {LINK:ToolPage;'tool'} during the 3rd Decannual Stationeer Solar Conference. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} life - so much so, the {LINK:ODA;ODA} designated it an official {LINK:ToolPage;'tool'} during the 3rd Decannual Stationeer Solar Conference. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} duty - so much so, the {LINK:ODA;ODA} designated it an official {LINK:ToolPage;'tool'} during the 3rd Decannual Stationeer Solar Conference. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} life - so much so, the {LINK:ODA;ODA} designated it an official {LINK:ToolPage;'tool'}. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Nothing says 'I care' like a security camera that's been linked a {THING:StructureMotionSensor} and a {THING:StructureConsole} fitted with a {THING:CircuitboardCameraDisplay}. Be there, even when you're not.

If a {THING:StructureRecycler} or unbalanced {THING:StructureFurnace} outputs {LINK:ReagentPage;reagent} mixture rather than the desired {LINK:IngotPage;ingots}, a centrifuge allows you to reclaim the raw {LINK:OrePage;ore}. It also refines {THING:ItemDirtyOre} produced from the {THING:StructureDeepMiner}. Its bigger brother {THING:StructureCombustionCentrifuge} can be used to process items significantly faster.
Items processed by the centrifuge will be de-gassed
One of the universe's many chairs, optimized for bipeds with somewhere between zero and two upper limbs.

The {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's} goal is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Like most {LINK:Recurso;Recurso}-designed systems, chute bins are simple and robust powered items, allowing items to be manually passed into chute networks by pulling a lever. They can also be programmed with {LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic} to operate automatically, although full automation requires the use items such as a {THING:StructureSDBHopper}.

Chutes act as pipes for items. Use them to connect various {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} equipment together such as the {THING:StructureVendingMachine} and printers like the {THING:StructureAutolathe}. The aim for any {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Chute corners are fundamental components of chute networks, which allow the transport of items between machines with {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} slots, such as the {THING:StructureFurnace} and other automatable structures.

The aim for any {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. The chute inlet is an aperture by which items can be introduced to {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} networks. Note that its origins in zero-gravity mining means chute inlets are unpowered and permanently open, rather than interactable, allowing objects to be thrown in. They can be connected to {LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic} systems to monitor throughput.

The aim for any {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Chute junctions are fundamental components of chute networks, allowing merging or splitting of these networks. When combined with a programmed {THING:StructureSorter}, items can be sent down different paths to various machines with {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} slots.

The aim for any {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. The chute outlet is an aperture for exiting items from {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} networks. Note that the outlet's origins in zero-gravity mining means they are permanently open, rather than interactable, but can be connected to {LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic} systems to monitor throughput.

Chutes act as pipes for items. Use them to connect various {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} equipment together such as the {THING:StructureVendingMachine} and printers like the {THING:StructureAutolathe}. The aim for any {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Chutes are fundamental components of chute networks, which allow the transport of items between any machine or device with an {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} slot.
{LINK:Recurso;Recurso's} composite doors are rated to 300kPa, which is more than sufficient for most purposes they were designed for. However, steep pressure differentials are not your friend.
While aesthetics rank low on the ladder of {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} concerns, composite gratings allow the concealment of unsightly cables on floors, walls and ceilings.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls favor form over function, coming in a range of slightly different, functionally identical varieties.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls favor form over function, coming in a range of slightly different, functionally identical varieties.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls come in several charming, near identical varieties - reflecting their designer's focus on form over function.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls come several charming, near identical varieties - reflecting their focus on form over function.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls come in several charming, near identical varieties - reflecting their focus on form over function.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls come in several charming, near identical varieties - reflecting their designer's focus on form over function.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls come in several charming, near identical varieties - reflecting their designer's focus on form over function.

This {LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed} control box manages devices such as the {THING:StructureActiveVent}, {THING:StructureGasSensor}, {THING:StructureCompositeDoor} and others, depending on which {LINK:LogicPage;circuitboard} is inserted into the unit. It has separate data and power ports. A completed console displays all devices connected to the current power network. Any devices not related to the installed circuitboard will be greyed-out and inoperable. Consoles are locked once a {THING:ItemDataDisk} is removed.

This {LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed} control box manages devices such as the {THING:StructureActiveVent}, {THING:StructurePassiveVent}, {THING:StructureGasSensor}, {THING:ItemSecurityCamera} and {THING:StructureCompositeDoor}, depending on which {LINK:LogicPage;circuitboard} is inserted into the unit. It has a shared data/power port, and a charming sloped interface. A completed console displays all devices connected to the current power network. Any devices not related to the installed circuitboard will be greyed-out and inoperable. Consoles are locked once a {THING:ItemDataDisk} is removed.
Once, these chairs were the heart of space-going behemoths. Now, they're items of nostalgia built only by a handful of Stationeers with a sense of history. In other words, kitsch.

Originally designed by {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} for ore-shifting, Flexi-belt conveyor solutions can be customized to specific uses for facilitating efficient transportation workflows. In other words, they move stuff between places. An recurring {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages : 'We're working on that.'

Originally designed by {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} for ore-shifting, Flexi-belt conveyor solutions can be customized to specific uses for facilitating efficient transportation workflows. In other words, they move stuff between places - and up slightly, in the case of the riser. An recurring {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages : 'We're working on that.'

Originally designed by {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} for ore-shifting, Flexi-belt conveyor solutions can be customized to specific uses for facilitating efficient transportation workflows. In other words, they move stuff between places. An recurring {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages : 'We're working on that.'

In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages : 'We're working on that.'
